  - [x] Make Catalog2AzureSearch wait on registration5 as well

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Integrate package versioning playground tool into NuGet.org" (#7917) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
**Problem:** Figuring out which versions of a package a version range or floating version will resolve to can be confusing at times. Currently, there is not a publicly available tool to help customers figure this out.

**Solution:** @joelverhagen has a neat web app that does exactly this, but may need some work regarding scalability and UI before being featured on NuGet.org. 

[Web App](https://nugettoolsdev.azurewebsites.net/5.5.0-floating.7611/find-best-version-match?versionRange=1.*-*&versions=1.0.0%0D%0A2.0.0-test%0D%0A%0D%0A)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Automatically download and embed icon from iconUrl" (#7916) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
**Problem:** At some point nuget.org will stop accepting packages with iconUrls in favor of migrating package authors to embedded icons. This will require package authors to modify their current metadata practices.

**Solution:** Automatically download the image from and iconUrl and embed it into the nupkg as pack time. This will achieve the same benefits of embedded icons (because the icon will be embedded), while making the transition a seamless experience to the package author.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Login first time unknown error" (#7915) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Describe the bug
When I try to create an account it let me logs into my microsoft account and is asking for permission. After I accept the permission, I get an email from microsoft that nuget is allowed to read different information of my account. However when redirecting back to the nuget login page it shows a unknown error and doesn't let me login.

### To Reproduce
1) go to [login page of nuget](https://www.nuget.org/users/account/LogOn)
2) Use the "Sign in with Microsoft" button
3) Enter login info
4) Accept the information that nuget wants to access.
5) Return to the login page of nuget with the unknown error 

### Expected behavior
To login and use the nuget website to retrieve an api key so I can upload my nuget package

### Additional context
I have tried multiple emails, personal, company and school. All of them gave the same error.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Usabilla] Search feedback." (#7913) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "API / endpoint for snupkg's" (#7912) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
We need an API / metadata on the package that points to a snupkg, if the package has one.

The scenario is that tooling may need to download all symbols for a NuGet package as part of validation steps, such as ensuring the Source Link information is properly embedded.

Currently the only option is to use the CDN endpoint, and check with a HEAD:  `https://globalcdn.nuget.org/symbol-packages/{lowercase ID}.{lowercase normalized version}.snupkg`

There's no guarantees around this endpoint, however.

Downloading each PDB via the symbol server API is less efficient as each pdb needs to be calculated and downloaded, if published, individually. For validation scenarios, all pdb's would be required anyway.

--

There's another scenario where people find it generally useful to see what's in the snupkg package, downloading and opening with a tool like NuGet Package Explorer.

--

NuGet Package Explorer intends on helping people know if packages are properly Source Linked and thus needs to perform all these steps: https://github.com/NuGetPackageExplorer/NuGetPackageExplorer/issues/904

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "CodeFlow - insertion into VS/SDK" (#9334) at NuGet/Home
Closed issue "Really need package sorting options" (#1739) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: In the VS Package Manager there is no sorting being applied that I can tell. This make it really hard for even simple projects when the # of packages gets larger than a single screen.  It gets worse as you combine multiple package sources.  When trying to find a package (installed, updateable, etc) you end up having to search for it rather than quickly scanning down the list of packages.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Add a design spec template that the NuGet team uses" (#9312) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Fixes https://github.com/NuGet/Client.Engineering/issues/154

This is basically a summary of the spec we have been using. 

Only change I've made is making all the `Open Questions`, `Considerations` etc. a heading 2. 

Once merged I will update any links in the wiki and one notes I can find talking about a spec template :) 

@skofman1 @xavierdecoster @joelverhagen @agr @shishirx34 @ryuyu @dannyjdev @loic-sharma @zhhyu  
Thoughts/comments welcome. Figured you have your own template, maybe we can unify to using one.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Test Failure] Error page ‘An error occur while attempting to open NuGet’ appeared after reopening the solution " (#9239) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet Version: NuGet Client Dev\5.6.0.6478
VS Version: Master\29901.03
OS Version: Windows-10-Enterprise-RS5

## Installation steps:

Install VS: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_build/results?buildId=3516003&view=results

## Repro steps:

1.	Create a C# Console App (.Net Core) project.
2.	Open ‘Manage NuGet Packages’.
3.	Save the solution and Close the solution.
4.	Reopen the solution.

## Expected:

There is no error after reopening the solution.

## Actual:

Error page ‘An error occur while attempting to open NuGet’ appeared as below screenshot.
![Capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20632775/75665710-8d6d3c80-5caf-11ea-990a-ac2f8663cb9e.PNG)


## Notes:
1.	The issue also repro on other projects.
2.	It didn't repro on VS D16.5\29827.131 with Implicit NuGet Client Release-5.5.x\5.5.0.6473.
3.	It didn't repro on VS Master\29826.166+NuGet Client Dev\5.6.0.6478.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "MSBuild Restore is flaky (with corext bridge)" (#9314) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe): msbuild /restore

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx): unknown (CloudBuild)

dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate): n/a

VS version (if appropriate): n/a

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)): Unknown (CloudBuild)

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: no

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

[This](https://cloudbuild.microsoft.com/build/63e1c919-11df-45b2-ba72-7f082a0a0eae?bq=CDP_PowerQuery-Web) is an example of corext init timing out. From talking to a colleague it seems like msbuild is crashing/hanging when trying to build the list of projects to be restored. msbuild was ran with /bl so there are dump files of the processes here. This is the most common issue we are facing.

[This](https://cloudbuild.microsoft.com/build/b059eaf8-61f2-4c8f-a3f1-11703cd25210?bq=CDP_PowerQuery-Web) is an example where the restore fails. What's odd is there are no warnings or errors in the restore.log. This is less common.

## Other suggested things

### Verbose Logs

Included above

### Sample Project

https://msazure.visualstudio.com/One/_git/PowerQuery-Web/

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "PMUI could be more explicit/strict regarding native API Failures" (#9351) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
If a native API fails, we can choose to throw those exceptions. In most cases, we don't throw and silently ignore them. In a recent PR of mine, I throw, and this generated a lot of discussion which I'm formalizing here. 

Throwing from the PMUI stack causes our telemetry to document the exception, but our UI continues to operate in an unintended state.

Example: 
I added [ThrowOnError in this commit](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/f3581c38ef62b2e4f4a6e299a712c64562147e73/src/NuGet.Clients/NuGet.VisualStudio.Common/WindowFrameHelper.cs#L30).
The user doesn't see the error message from this exception. In this case, the Window will not open, but it can be re-opened if the user attempts to open it again, but it'll have the original bug my PR was addressing because the SetProperty API failed silently.

The balance should be between keeping the UI working as much as possible, while not silencing errors from APIs we rely on. 

Understanding our telemetry strategy for discovering failures like this is another good point.

**Inspired by Discussion from PR Comment:** https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/3317#discussion_r398864866

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Deprecating TLS 1.0 and 1.1 on NuGet.org – Stage 1" (#42) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
## NuGet.org will temporarily remove support for TLS 1.0/1.1 on February 26, 2020

We plan to temporarily remove support for TLS 1.0/1.1 across 3 time slots in a 24 hour period, for 4 hours each, to ensure overlap with normal working hours across the globe. If you discover that you are impacted and cannot identify a workaround, please open an issue on the NuGet Gallery GitHub repo.

Read this blog post to learn more and to identify the test slot time in your time zone - https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/deprecating-tls-1-0-and-1-1-on-nuget-org-stage-1/
